title.narrative: Preservation of the Ancient Extramural Sanctuary of Demeter and Persephone at Cyrene

description.narrative: To support a comprehensive assessment and emergency stabilization of the ruins of the extramural Sanctuary of Demeter and Persephone at the Greco-Roman site of Cyrene in eastern Libya, the largest known and best preserved sanctuary in the eastern Mediterranean dedicated to the two goddesses. In use for more than 800 years until destroyed by earthquakes in the late 3rd and early 4th centuries, the sanctuary is vulnerable subject to physical degradation, vandalism, looting, urban encroachment, and environmental pollution. This project includes a comprehensive site survey, conservation assessment, and soil and other studies in preparation for the site's future conservation.
